factText: The death toll is now reportedly at seven after at least two tornadoes touched down in Tennessee. At least seven people were reportedly killed early Tuesday morning after at least two tornadoes touched down. Tornadoes tore through Nashville and central Tennessee overnight, with press reports on Tuesday indicating the death toll rising to 22, with 'hundreds displaced from their homes and dozens of buildings damaged or destroyed'

Hundreds are without homes after two tornadoes ripped though Nashville early this morning. People received and heeded the warnings, but did not have access to adequate shelter before the tornado impacted them. In the past 5 years, Kansas Emergency Departments have reported at least 12 of 39 tornado-related injuries due to people seeking shelter in a vehicle on the highway. My heart is heavy and I’m praying for everyone’s safety, shelter, and comfort during this tornado.

There are reports of at least 40 buildings collapsed. Over 40 structure collapses have been reported as a result of this storm which hit at 1:30 AM EST (12:30 AM local time). Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Numerous fatalities have been reported along with numerous homes and business that have been leveled.
